alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued December 18 at 3:35PM EST until December 19 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 12 feet in the surf zone. * WHERE...Ocracoke Island and Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the High Surf Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. * IMPACTS...Up to 2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Minor to locally moderate ocean overwash possible which could affect travel on NC HWY 12 on Ocracoke Island and between Frisco and Hatteras Village. Some shoreline erosion will occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Flooding is expected soundside today as the winds shifted to the west with potential for rapid water level rises. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Ocracoke Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.0 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.9 ft, Moderate 2.9 ft, Major 4.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/12 AM 2.3 1.2 1.3 3 None 19/01 PM 2.5 1.4 1.5 2-3 None 20/02 AM 2.2 1.1 1.2 2 None 20/02 PM 2.1 1.0 1.1 2 None 21/02 AM 2.1 1.0 1.0 2 None Coast Guard Hatteras NC MLLW Categories - Minor 2.5 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 4.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.3 ft, Moderate 2.3 ft, Major 3.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 19/12 PM 2.8 1.6 2.1 2-3 Minor 20/12 AM 2.6 1.4 2.0 2 Minor 20/01 PM 2.3 1.1 1.6 2 None 21/02 AM 2.4 1.2 1.7 2 None 21/01 PM 2.3 1.1 1.8 1-2 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
